Docs.summary: Extends design-time behavior for the Web server control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CreateUserWizardDesigner> class if you want to create a designer for a class that extends the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CreateUserWizard> Web server control.
## Examples The following code example shows how to extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CreateUserWizardDesigner> class and display debugging information on the design surface in case of an error.
[!code-csharp[WebNet.Design.WebControls.CreateUserWizardDesigner#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/WebNet.Design.WebControls.CreateUserWizardDesigner/CS/createuserdesigner.cs#1)] [!code-vb[WebNet.Design.WebControls.CreateUserWizardDesigner#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/WebNet.Design.WebControls.CreateUserWizardDesigner/VB/createuserdesigner.vb#1)]
The following code example shows how to associate a control class with the designer defined in the preceding example.
[!code-csharp[WebNet.Design.WebControls.CreateUserWizardDesigner#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/WebNet.Design.WebControls.CreateUserWizardDesigner/CS/createuser.cs#2)] [!code-vb[WebNet.Design.WebControls.CreateUserWizardDesigner#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/WebNet.Design.WebControls.CreateUserWizardDesigner/VB/createuser.vb#2)]

Gets the object for this designer.

Docs.param: The to which regions associated with the wizard control are added.
Docs.summary: Creates a object for each step associated with the underlying wizard control, and then adds it to the specified object.
Gets the object associated with this designer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void ConvertToCustomNavigationTemplate() cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts the child controls associated with the underlying wizard control to a custom navigation template.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetErrorDesignTimeHtml(class System.Exception e) cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the HTML that provides information about the specified exception. This method is typically called after an error has been encountered at design time.
Docs.returns: The HTML for the specified exception.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CreateUserWizardDesigner.GetErrorDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to display debugging information on the design surface in case of an error.
[!code-csharp[WebNet.Design.WebControls.CreateUserWizardDesigner#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/WebNet.Design.WebControls.CreateUserWizardDesigner/CS/createuserdesigner.cs#1)] [!code-vb[WebNet.Design.WebControls.CreateUserWizardDesigner#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/WebNet.Design.WebControls.CreateUserWizardDesigner/VB/createuserdesigner.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Initialize(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes the designer and loads the specified component.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void PreFilterProperties(class System.Collections.IDictionary properties) cil managed

Docs.param: The objects that represent the properties of the component's base class. The keys in the dictionary of properties are property names.
Docs.summary: Exposes the properties associated with each default step through the property grid on the designer tool.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CreateUserWizardDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method provides a way to add items to the dictionary of properties that a designer exposes.
The keys in the dictionary of properties are the names of the properties. The objects are of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor>.

block.para: You can directly modify the dictionary that is accessible through the parameter, or you can leave it unchanged. If you are overriding the method, call the base implementation before you perform your own filtering.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the designer uses the control itself to generate the design-time HTML or uses a temporarily created copy.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CreateUserWizardDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property is `true`, the designer uses a temporary copy of the wizard control to generate the design-time HTML; when the value of <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CreateUserWizardDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> is `false`, the designer uses the wizard control itself to generate the design-time HTML.
The value of <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CreateUserWizardDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> modifies the return value of the designer's <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ViewControl%2A> property. When <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CreateUserWizardDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> is `true`, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ViewControl%2A> returns a copy of the wizard control. When <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CreateUserWizardDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> is `false`, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.ViewControl%2A> returns the wizard control itself.
If the wizard control is marked with a class-level <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.SupportsPreviewControlAttribute> attribute, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.SupportsPreviewControlAttribute> is ignored, because the value of <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CreateUserWizardDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> is always `true`.

block.para: You can override the property to return or to determine its value based on whether the wizard control is marked with a class-level . If the is not overridden, the designer ignores the .
